summary.span: Represents a record sequence stored in a .

span.span: Represents a record sequence stored in a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別會在一般記錄檔系統 (CLFS) 記錄頂端提供記錄順序介面實作。The class provides an implementation of the record sequence interface on top of a Common Log File System (CLFS) log. 除了標準的記錄導向功能之外，它還提供了一個原則模型，可用來避免記錄檔已滿狀況，以及在同一實體檔案上進行用戶端多工。In addition to the standard record-oriented features, it provides a policy model for avoiding log-full conditions, and multiplexing of clients on the same physical file. 它會搭配使用 類別，這個類別會提供用來直接操作和管理 CLFS 記錄檔的介面。It works with the class, which provides an interface for directly manipulating and managing a CLFS log file. 類別與 類別的關係就如同磁碟檔案與 物件的關係。The relationship between the class and the class is similar to the relationship between a disk file and a object. 磁碟檔案提供實際的儲存區且具有「長度」和「上次存取時間」等屬性，而 物件則提供檔案的檢視，可用來讀取和寫入檔案。The disk file provides the concrete storage, and has attributes such as length and last access time; while the object provides a view on the file that can be used to read from it and write to it. 同樣地， 類別也具有原則和延伸磁碟區集合等屬性；而 類別則會提供用來讀取和寫入資料的記錄導向機制。Similarly, the class has attributes like a policy and a collection of disk extents; and the class provides a record-oriented mechanism for reading and writing data. ## Examples 這個範例會說明如何使用 類別：This example shows how to use the class: [!code-csharp[S_UELogRecordSequence#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/cs/mylogrecordsequence.cs#0)] [!code-vb[S_UELogRecordSequence#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uelogrecordsequence/vb/mylogrecordsequence.vb#0)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您應該將目前方法傳回的 傳遞給 方法，以確保清除完成，並適當釋放資源。You should pass the returned by the current method to the method to ensure that the flush completes and resources are freed appropriately. 如果在非同步清除期間發生錯誤，則必須在使用這個方法傳回的 呼叫 方法後才會擲回例外狀況。If an error occurs during an asynchronous flush, an exception is not thrown until the method is called with the returned by this method. 呼叫這個方法可以確保已永久寫入附加到 的所有記錄。Calling this method ensures that all records that have been appended to the are durably written. 如果處置了記錄順序，或是您傳遞了無效的引數，就會立即在此作業中擲回例外狀況。If a record sequence has been disposed of, or if you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately within this operation. 在非同步清除要求期間發生的錯誤 (例如，在 I/O 要求期間發生的磁碟錯誤)，會導致在呼叫 方法時擲回例外狀況。Errors that occurred during an asynchronous flush request, for example, a disk failure during the I/O request, will result in exceptions being thrown when the method is called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您應該將這個方法所傳回的 傳遞給 方法，以確定附加作業已完成，而且可以適當地釋放資源。You should pass the returned by this method to the method to ensure that the append operation has completed and resources can be freed appropriately. 如果在非同步附加期間發生錯誤，就要等到系統以這個方法傳回的 呼叫 方法時，才會擲回例外狀況。If an error has occurred during an asynchronous append, an exception is not thrown until the method is called with the returned by this method. 包含在 `data` 參數中的資料將串連至單一位元組陣列中，以便附加成記錄。Data contained in the `data` parameter will be concatenated into a single byte array for appending as the record. 不過，在讀取記錄時，並不會將資料分割回陣列區段。However, no provision is made for splitting data back into array segments when the record is read. 指定的保留區會在不可部分完成的作業 (Atomic Operation) 與記錄附加作業中，加入至提供的保留區集合。The specified reservations are added to the provided reservation collection in an atomic operation with a record append operation. 如果附加失敗，就不會保留任何空間。If the append fails, no space is reserved. 這個方法通常可以在寫入記錄前完成。Normally, this method may complete before the record has been written. 若要確定已寫入某筆記錄，請使用 參數指定 `recordAppendOptions` 旗標，或是呼叫 方法。To ensure that a record has been written, either specify the flag using the `recordAppendOptions` parameter, or call the method. 如果處置了記錄順序，或是您傳遞了無效的引數，就會立即在此作業中擲回例外狀況。If a record sequence has been disposed of, or if you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately within this operation. 在非同步附加要求期間發生的錯誤 (例如，在 I/O 要求期間發生的磁碟錯誤) 會導致在呼叫 方法時擲回例外狀況。Errors that occurred during an asynchronous append request, for example, a disk failure during the I/O request, will result in exceptions being thrown when the method is called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您應該將這個方法所傳回的 傳遞給 方法，以確定重新啟動區域寫入作業已完成，而且可以適當地釋放資源。You should pass the returned by this method to the method to ensure that the restart area write operation has completed and resources can be freed appropriately. 如果在非同步重新啟動區域寫入作業期間發生錯誤，就要等到系統以這個方法傳回的 呼叫 方法時，才會擲回例外狀況。If an error has occurred during an asynchronous restart area write operation, an exception is not thrown until the method is called with the returned by this method. 包含在 `data` 參數中的資料將串連至單一位元組陣列中，以便附加成記錄。Data contained in the `data` parameter will be concatenated into a single byte array for appending as the record. 不過，在讀取記錄時，並不會將資料分割回陣列區段。However, no provision is made for splitting data back into array segments when the record is read. 當這個作業成功完成時，基底序號已經更新。When the operation successfully completes, the base sequence number has been updated. 只要是序號小於新基底序號的所有記錄都無法存取。All log records with sequence numbers less than the new base sequence number are inaccessible. 如果已指定 ，寫入的重新啟動區域將會使用包含在集合中的保留區，以取用先前所保留的空間。If a is specified, the written restart area will consume space that has been previously reserved, using a reservation contained in the collection. 如果此方法成功，便會取用可以保存資料的最小保留區，而且該保留區將會從集合移除。If the method succeeds, it will consume the smallest reservation that can hold the data, and that reservation will be removed from the collection. 如果處置了記錄順序，或是您傳遞了無效的引數，就會立即在此作業中擲回例外狀況。If a record sequence has been disposed of, or if you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately within this operation. 在非同步附加要求期間發生的錯誤 (例如，在 I/O 要求期間發生的磁碟錯誤) 會導致在呼叫 方法時擲回例外狀況。Errors that occurred during an asynchronous append request, for example, a disk failure during the I/O request, will result in exceptions being thrown when the method is called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 包含在 `data` 參數中的資料將串連至單一位元組陣列中，以便附加成記錄。Data contained in the `data` parameter will be concatenated into a single byte array for appending as the record. 不過，在讀取記錄時，並不會將資料分割回陣列區段。However, no provision is made for splitting data back into array segments when the record is read. 指定的保留區會在不可部分完成的作業 (Atomic Operation) 與記錄附加作業中，加入至提供的保留區集合。The specified reservations are added to the provided reservation collection in an atomic operation with a record append operation. 如果附加失敗，就不會保留任何空間。If the append fails, no space is reserved. 這個方法通常可以在寫入記錄前完成。Normally, this method may complete before the record has been written. 若要確定已寫入某筆記錄，請使用 參數指定 `recordAppendOptions` 旗標，或是呼叫 方法。To ensure that a record has been written, either specify the flag using the `recordAppendOptions` parameter, or call the method. ## Examples 下列範例顯示如何使用這個方法來建立保留區。The following example shows how to use this method to make reservations. 請注意，您只能在使用 CLFS 的 類別時執行這項工作。Notice that this task can only be performed when using the CLFS-based class. ``` ReservationCollection reservations = recordSequence.CreateReservationCollection(); long[] lengthOfUndoRecords = new long[] { 1000 }; recordSequence.ReserveAndAppend(recordData, userSqn, previousSqn, RecordSequenceAppendOptions.None, reservations, lengthOfUndoRecords); recordSequence.Append(undoRecordData, // If necessary … userSqn, previousSqn, RecordSequenceAppendOptions.ForceFlush, reservations); ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 重新啟動區域可用來暫時儲存包含用戶端上一個檢查點作業的資訊。A restart area is used to temporarily store information containing a client's last checkpoint operation. 一般記錄檔系統 (CLFS) 會維護兩個重新啟動區域，以保證至少有一個有效區域永遠可供使用。The Common Log File System (CLFS) maintains two restart areas to guarantee that at least one valid area is always available. 當需要復原時，CLFS 會讀取其重新啟動區域，以及上一個檢查點作業傳回的所有資料。When a recovery is necessary, the CLFS reads its restart area and all the data from the last checkpoint operation. 這些資料會初始化異動資料表、中途分頁資料表和開啟檔案資料表，好讓它們可用於復原程序。This data initializes the transaction table, dirty pages table, and open file table so they can be used in the recovery process. 使用 方法，您就可以移除最近寫入的重新啟動區域。Using the method, you can remove the most recently written restart area.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 重新啟動區域可用來暫時儲存包含用戶端上一個檢查點作業的資訊。A restart area is used to temporarily store information containing a client's last checkpoint operation. 一般記錄檔系統 (CLFS) 會維護兩個重新啟動區域，以保證至少有一個有效區域永遠可供使用。The Common Log File System (CLFS) maintains two restart areas to guarantee that at least one valid area is always available. 當需要復原時，CLFS 會讀取其重新啟動區域，以及上一個檢查點作業傳回的所有資料。When a recovery is necessary, the CLFS reads its restart area and all the data from the last checkpoint operation. 這些資料會初始化異動資料表、中途分頁資料表和開啟檔案資料表，好讓它們可用於復原程序。This data initializes the transaction table, dirty pages table, and open file table so they can be used in the recovery process. 您可以使用 方法來讀取重新啟動區域。A restart area can be read using the method. 當寫入重新啟動區域時，位元組陣列區段中的資料會串連至單一位元組陣列，以便附加為記錄。When a restart area is written, the data in the byte array segments are concatenated into a single byte array for appending as the record. 在讀取重新啟動區域時，不會將資料分割回陣列區段。No provision is made for splitting data back into array segments when the restart area is read. 當這個方法成功完成時，基底序號已經更新。When this method successfully completes, the base sequence number has been updated. 只要是序號小於新基底序號的所有記錄都無法存取。All log records with sequence numbers less than the new base sequence number are inaccessible. 如果處置了記錄順序，或是您傳遞了無效的引數，就會立即在此作業中擲回例外狀況。If a record sequence has been disposed of, or if you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately within this operation. 在非同步附加要求期間發生的錯誤 (例如，在 I/O 要求期間發生的磁碟錯誤) 會導致在呼叫 方法時擲回例外狀況。Errors that occurred during an asynchronous append request, for example, a disk failure during the I/O request, will result in exceptions being thrown when the method is called.
